Om anställningen avser befattning i säkerhetsklass kommer säkerhetsprövningen även att innefatta en registerkontroll och, i vissa fall, en särskild personutredning. För anställning på Svenska kraftnät krävs svenskt medborgarskap. Med anställningen följer en skyldighet att krigsplaceras.
   

  

 För mer information om säkerhetsprövning Svenska kraftnät arbetar för att främja mångfald och motverka diskriminering och ser gärna sökanden med olika bakgrund och erfarenheter till våra rekryteringar. Lär känna Svenska kraftnät och hur det är att arbeta hos oss: Lär känna oss på Svenska kraftnät

title: Supporttekniker till Sveriges största statliga forskningsfinansiär!
description:
Vi söker nu en passionerad supporttekniker som vill arbeta på en arbetsplats som verkligen gör skillnad! Hos vår kund kommer du inte bara att lösa tekniska problem – du kommer också att vara en del av en organisation som ligger i framkant av svensk forskning och innovation. Om du är redo att ta nästa steg i din karriär och vill vara med och skapa förutsättningar för Sveriges forskningsframgångar, tveka inte att söka denna spännande tjänst som supporttekniker!
 



  

**Plats :**
 Stockholm
 



  

**Jobbkategori :**
 Kundtjänst
 



  

**Omfattning :**
 Heltid
 



  

**Startdatum :**
 Omgående
 



  

**Typ av uppdrag :**
 Konsultuppdrag
   




**Om tjänsten**

 Vår kund är Sveriges största statliga forskningsfinansiär, en organisation som stödjer forskning av högsta kvalitet inom alla vetenskapsområden. Här arbetar du i hjärtat av forskningsvärlden, där banbrytande idéer föds och utvecklas. Du kommer att vara en viktig kugge i maskineriet som gör att forskningen kan fortsätta driva samhället framåt.
   

 Här blir du snabbt en självklar del av en inspirerande och dynamisk miljö, omgiven av engagerade kollegor som brinner för att forskning ska komma till nytta i samhället. Här värdesätts samarbete, men det finns även stort utrymme för självständigt arbete och personligt ansvar.
 


  


  

**Du erbjuds**



  

  
* Chansen att vara med och stötta forskning som bidrar till samhällsutveckling.
  
* Arbeta i en miljö där teknik och vetenskap möts, och där ditt arbete gör skillnad.
  
* En utvecklande roll där ingen dag är den andra lik.
  

  


**Arbetsuppgifter**
  
* Självständigt lösa problem som första linjens supporttekniker.
  
* Administrera konton, behörigheter och hantera konton via AD Basic och Entra ID.
  
* Arbeta med grundläggande funktioner i M365 och Intune.
  
* Förbereda och underhålla datorer (Windows 10 och 11) samt mobila enheter (iPhone och Samsung).
  
* Hantera VPN-anslutningar och teknisk utrustning i konferensrum.
  

  


**Vi söker dig som**
  
* Tidigare arbetat i en liknande roll inom first line-support.
  
* Du är van vid att arbeta med fileshare och kan grunderna i system som används för att dela filer och information.
  
* Erfarenhet av Active Directory.
  
* Grundläggande kunskap om VPN.
  
* Erfarenhet av hantering och support inom Microsoft365 och Intune.
  
* Erfarenhet av teknik i konferensrum
   

  

**För att lyckas i rollen har du följande personliga egenskaper:**
  
* Är lösningsorienterad och trivs med att arbeta självständigt, samtidigt som du vet när det är dags att eskalera ärenden till andra linjens support.
  
* Har ett starkt serviceinriktat mindset och förstår vikten av att hålla en hög servicenivå.
  
* Är van att arbeta i en varierande miljö och snabbt kan anpassa dig till nya tekniska utmaningar.
  


  

  

**Vår rekryteringsprocess**
  


 Denna rekryteringsprocess hanteras av Academic Work och vår kunds önskemål är att alla frågor rörande tjänsten skickas till Academic Work.
 


  


 Vi tillämpar löpande urval och kommer plocka ner annonsen när tillräckligt många kandidater har nått slutskedet i rekryteringsprocessen. Rekryteringsprocessen innehåller två urvalstest: ett personlighetstest och ett test i kognitiv förmåga. Testerna är ett verktyg för att kunna hitta den kandidat med högst potential för tjänsten samt främja jämlikhet, mångfald och en rättvis rekryteringsprocess.
   




**Bli en del av Academic Work**

 Som konsult för Academic Work erbjuds du stora möjligheter att växa professionellt och knyta värdefulla kontakter för framtiden. Du får en konsultchef som stöttar dig under resans gång och får ta del av olika förmåner, bl.a. möjlighet till kompetensutveckling i form av en grundläggande hållbarhetsutbildning.
 


 Läs mer om vårt konsulterbjudande här
   

**Har du frågor om tjänsten?**

 Filippa Danell Karlberg eller någon av kollegorna i rekryteringsteamet svarar dig gärna på sth2@academicwork.se Ange annons-ID i ditt mail: 15106990

title: Fullstack-utvecklare med fokus .NET/C# 50-75%
description:
**Företagsbeskrivning**
 I allt vi gör tror vi på att utveckla människor. Hos oss når du din fulla potential och har roligt samtidigt. Är du redo för en spännande och fartfylld resa? Lockas du av det lilla i det stora? I så fall är det dig vi söker. Följ med på vår resa i ett snabbt växande internationellt företag!
   

  

**Jobbeskrivning**
 Nu söker vi en ny kollega med kompetens inom C#/.NET. I det här uppdraget kommer du få sitta tillsammans med ett team som ska jobba tillsammans för att bygga backend-lösningar för denna kund som verkar inom logistik. Slutprodukten utvecklas i Jönköping där en del av teamet sitter, men du kan också utgå från Stockholm där vi har vårt kontoror, eller andra delar av Sverige.
   

  

 Som konsult hos oss hoppas vi även att du är intresserad av att stötta utvecklingen av vår affär inom .NET området eller eventuella andra talanger inom mjukvaruutveckling som du brinner för, tillsammans med våra affärsutvecklare och rekryterare.
   

  

**Vad ingår i jobbet som webbutvecklare på Segula?**
 Som backend-utvecklare på Segula vill du bygga din karriär inom backend.
   

  

 För tillfället söker vi en utvecklare som kan stötta vår kund i resan att utveckla framtidens säljsystem i en industriell miljö. Som .NET utvecklare i vår Stockholmsenhet hoppas vi även att du är intresserad av att stötta teamet med att utveckla vårt erbjudande inom tjänster som rör .NET utveckling.
   

  

**Du Kan Få Arbeta Med Uppgifter Så Som**
* Skapa och utveckla webbapplikationer och -tjänster
* Designa och skapa kundlösningar i Cloud, AWS eller Azure
* Skapa WEB - API:er och fasader för integrationer


**Kvalifikationer**
* Har jobbat med webbutveckling baserad på C#/ & .Net, 3-5 års erfarenhet
* Har erfarenhet av att jobba med React, Angular eller liknande ramverk
* Har erfarenhet att jobba med relationsdatabaser (SQL, Oracle eller liknande)
* Goda kunskaper i engelska, svenska är meriterande


**Ytterligare information**
 För att trivas här ser vi att du drivs av innovation, teknik samt personlig/karriärutveckling. Utöver det har du ett ”service mindset”, en djup teknisk nyfikenhet, trivs med att agera kunskapsresurs för andra samt är kvalitetsmedveten.
   

  

 Du behöver även ha ett arbetsvisa inom EU.
   

  

 Vi lägger stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper och rekryterar löpande. Om du har några brådskande frågor är du välkommen att ställa dem till Aria på aria.feizi@segulagrp.com.

title: SAP Finance consultant to Accenture’s Nordic SAP Business Group
description:
Do you have a passion for transforming businesses with the newest technologies and making them data-driven companies? Are you looking for a place where you could combine your business consulting skills with technology strategy know-how? Then our roles as SAP Finance consultant in our SAP Business Group are a perfect find for you!
   

  

 Bring your talent and passion to Accenture and help us deliver on the promise of technology and human ingenuity. Take this opportunity to develop your skills and build an extraordinary career. You will play a key role in transforming organizations and communities around the world. Let there be change!
   

  

**About Our Nordic SAP Business Group**
 Accenture and SAP have a longstanding relationship that extends more than 40 years. As the leading Nordic SAP transformation partner, we work with SAP end-to-end from product innovation to development and delivery. Together, we are revolutionizing the future of business through major SAP transformation programs with some of the biggest companies.
   

  

 Within our Nordic SAP community, we work with the newest SAP solutions and offerings such as SAP S/4 HANA Cloud, SAP CX, Ariba, SuccessFactors, SAP BTP and SAP RISE.
   

  

 We are now looking to expand our community at scale and are looking at candidates for several positions and seniority levels.
   

  

 To read more about our SAP Practice, visit us at https://www.accenture.com/us-en/services/sap-index
   

  

**What’s in it for you:**
- Work with some of the biggest SAP clients in large global implementation projects.

- Be an integral part of innovative SAP transformation projects.

- Significant development opportunities and support for progressing in your professional career.

- Rich opportunities to develop your business acumen, consulting toolbox, technical and professional skills.

- Access to comprehensive tools and frameworks supported by our global organization, including implementation methodologies, knowledge databases, industry leading add-on software, expert network and benchmarks.

- A dedicated mentor to guide you during your work with continuous feedback.

- Being part of our culture and core values in a truly human work environment.

- Utilize your functional and technical expertise in SAP Finance and other, by analyzing, designing, and implementing business processes supported by SAP best practice solutions.

- Utilize your Industry expertise in the field of SAP solutions to deliver client value as a professional individual and as part of a team.

- Take part in our highly engaged and diverse global network, for collaboration and delivery.

- Competitive compensation and benefits.

- Help clients’ sustainability agenda through SAP transformations.

- Be a valuable member of our Nordic SAP Finance Value Tower and contribute to thought leadership, competence development, and sales initiatives.

**SAP Finance Nordic Value Tower**
**Curious colleagues working within SAP Finance - We are a fantastic and diverse Nordic team consisting of around 60 colleagues in 5 countries and we are growing steadily.**
**What do we do?**
 Accenture provides a full range of SAP-based services and solutions for the Finance organization leveraging SAP Financials, which provides a complete financial management solution for a broad range of industries. SAP Financials is the leading enterprise software solution for accounting, financial reporting, performance management, and corporate governance.
   

  

 Our SAP Financials solution helps clients leverage the full range of SAP functionality for finance transformation. These SAP capabilities center around six key components:
   

  

**Financial Accounting & Operations (covering FI module, Real Estate and Travel Management)**
 Optimize our client's accounting processes based on the implementation and/or the upgrade of the SAP FI module
   

  

**Enterprise Performance Management (EPM) (covering CO module and SEM / Business Objects)** 
 Ensures that our clients can significantly measure and drive value from the planning and control cycle
   

  

**Enterprise Asset Management (EAM) Financials**
 Maximize the return on our client's investment, project and asset management processes
   

  

**Treasury and Financial Supply Chain Management (FSCM)** 
 Significantly improve effectiveness and efficiency of our client's treasury operations, safeguard their liquidity and ensure that financial risks are both identified and effectively managed
   

  

**Industry Specific Financials** 
 Implement specialized SAP functionality to support clients in industries with highly specialized financial accounting and processing requirements such as insurance, utilities and the public sector
   

  

**Governance Risk and Compliance (GRC)** 
 Combines profit-driven business concepts with new SAP technology to increase compliance efficiency and bring profitable insights into core business processes
   

  

**Required Qualifications**
- Several years of hands-on SAP experience in an onshore project role preferably in the Nordics)

- Hands on Finance experience from S/4HANA Finance solutions

- Good understanding of Finance process and their business value drivers

- Strong resonance with Accenture values

- Willingness and ability to quickly learn new concepts and technologies

- Eagerness to shape and work in a team-oriented environment

- Motivated, persistent, eager to optimize, drive for excellence

- Passionate about SAP, innovation and delivery of the latest technologies to your clients

- Effectively work with cross-functional teams/stakeholders in an international and fast-moving environment

- Strong analytical skills, result-oriented paired with highly structured working style and good sense of responsibility, flexibility, and team player

- Excellent communication (verbal and written) and presentation skills to address technical and non-technical audiences in English

- Strong will to pursue a problem, identify the source, and propose possible solutions in collaboration with other team members in a timely manner

- A Bachelor/Master’s degree

- We recruit at different levels. For manager level and above, we would like you to see having at least 7 years of relevant project experience as well as having led a team, and ideally also some earlier involvement in the acquisition of new projects .

**Preferred Qualifications**
- Experience in at least one S/4HANA or SAP Finance project work

- An SAP certification in relevant area

- Experience of the full lifecycle including estimating, planning, and delivering a solution end-to-end

- Deep business & industry experience in one or more industries

- Nordic (Danish, Norwegian, Swedish, or Finnish) language spoken

**Location**
**Stockholm, Gothenburg and Malmö**
 Equal is greater than - Accenture welcomes and encourages applications from a diverse group of backgrounds related to gender, age, ethnicity, culture, race, religion and belief, disability, nationality, sexual orientation, and gender identity. Inclusion and diversity are fundamental to our culture and core values, providing an environment where everyone brings distinct experience, talent and culture to their work. We invite you to be part of this diversity!
   

  

 Pleasenote that due to the summer season, our hiring process may be slower than usual. We apologize for any delay in responding to your applications. Rest assured, we are committed to reviewing each application thoroughly. We appreciate your patience during this time.

title: NetSuite - Swedish speaking-Sales Development Representative
description:
**Job Description**
**The Oracle NetSuite Sales Development Representative (SDR) Role**
 The SDR role provides a hands-on experience, sourcing and qualifying leads while building product knowledge and developing fundamental sales skills. We are looking to hire our next superstar sales representative to help us continue to accelerate our YoY growth through revenue generation. Within this role, you will get the best of both worlds – training and autonomy. It is an unmissable, hands-on learning opportunity that will allow you to contribute to our ongoing success.
   

  

**Want to know more? Check out these resources.**
* NetSuite Instagram
* Netsuite Website
* Netsuite Customer Testimonials
* Netsuite LinkedIn Page
* Netsuite YouTube Channel


**Your Responsibilities**
* Analyze and understand prospective customer needs, personas, processes, projects and requirements in order to determine potential solutions.
* Perform outbound prospecting through cold-calling, emails and social media to generate high quality, BANT qualified leads that can be promoted to sales.
* Acquire and maintain a solid understanding of Oracle NetSuite solutions and our value proposition so that you can speak around value and return on investment vs technical functionalities.

 In order to nurture the talent that makes this happen, we are committed to an inclusive culture that celebrates and values diverse insights and perspectives, a workforce that inspires thought leadership and innovation.

Oracle will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records pursuant to applicable law.
   

  

 https://www.oracle.com/corporate/careers/diversity-inclusion/
   

  

**About Us**
 As a world leader in cloud solutions, Oracle uses tomorrow’s technology to tackle today’s problems. True innovation starts with diverse perspectives and various abilities and backgrounds.
   

  

 When everyone’s voice is heard, we’re inspired to go beyond what’s been done before. It’s why we’re committed to expanding our inclusive workforce that promotes diverse insights and perspectives.
   

  

 We’ve partnered with industry-leaders in almost every sector—and continue to thrive after 40+ years of change by operating with integrity.
   

  

 Oracle careers open the door to global opportunities where work-life balance flourishes. We offer a highly competitive suite of employee benefits designed on the principles of parity and consistency. We put our people first with flexible medical, life insurance and retirement options. We also encourage employees to give back to their communities through our volunteer programs.
   

  

 We’re committed to including people with disabilities at all stages of the employment process. If you require accessibility assistance or accommodation for a disability at any point, let us know by calling +1 888 404 2494, option one.

 Oracle is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer\*. Oracle will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records pursuant to applicable law.

title: Senior C++ Developer, Tbricks Retail | SEB, Solna
description:
At SEB we try to be at the forefront of financial technology, building robust and scalable solutions for the banking sector. Our
 **Order Management System (OMS)** 
 is a critical component of our trading infrastructure, handling high-volume transactions across multiple asset classes and exchanges. We’re looking for an experienced
 **Senior C++ Developer** 
 to help enhance and scale this vital system.
   

  

**About the role:**
 We are looking for a
 **Senior C++ Developer** 
 to join our
 **Order Management Team** 
 , responsible for developing and maintaining systems that process large volumes of financial transactions in real-time. As part of this team, you’ll contribute to the core trading infrastructure, ensuring low-latency, high-performance order execution, and compliance with exchange regulations.
   

  

 You are a team player who will work closely with product owners and other teams to design and implement features that enhance the banks offering to both internal and external clients. You should be able to understand problems from the user’s perspective and collaborate with other developers on high-level concepts. Each developer is responsible for the entire process, including architecture, design, coding, deployment, customer feedback, and bug fixes - ensuring full control and ownership of their work without dividing tasks among multiple people.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities:**
* Develop and maintain a high-performance Order Management System (OMS) using C++ to handle real-time transactions across multiple financial exchanges and asset classes.
* Implement low-latency, high-throughput algorithms to optimize order routing, execution, and trade processing.
* Work with multithreaded and distributed systems to ensure scalability and reliability in a 24/7 trading environment.
* Collaborate with business teams to understand and develop features to support their needs.
* Perform performance tuning, profiling, and troubleshooting to ensure minimal downtime and high system availability.
* Mentor junior team members, conduct code reviews, and contribute to setting best practices and architectural standards.


**What We're Looking For:**
* Technical Proficiency: Advanced expertise in C++ (C++14/17/20), proficiency in Python and Bash scripting, experience with Git and CI tools (preferably GitHub Actions), and a solid understanding of Linux environments.
* Strong knowledge of multithreading, memory management, and networking protocols.
* Ability to work with legacy systems and mainframe environments and supporting smooth integration with them.


**Bonus Skills:**
* Familiarity with trading environments, like Order Management Systems, including experience with equities, derivatives, or foreign exchange (FX) markets.
* Experience with FIX protocol and other financial messaging formats.
* Knowledge of SQL and NoSQL databases for managing trade data.
* Familiarity with cloud platforms (AWS, Google Cloud) and containerization technologies like Docker or Kubernetes.
* Messaging systems like Kafka or RabbitMQ.


**Do you want to be a part of SEB?**
 Welcome to our inclusive culture, where our shared values inspire and uplift our team. We celebrate diversity and strive to ensure every employee feels seen, heard, and valued.
   

  

 Since we select candidates continuously, please send in your application today, but no later than 2024-10-31. If you have questions about the position, please contact Magnus Henriksson, Team Manager, at magnus.henriksson@seb.se.
   

  

**Learn more about working at SEB** 
 www.sebgroup.com/career
   

  

 It is our fundamental belief that inclusion and diversity is crucial for our future success. We strive to have an inclusive, value-driven culture where employees feel valued, respected and involved irrespective of who they are, what they believe or where they come from.

title: R&D Engineer - HVDC Insulation Design
description:
**Description**


Are you passionate about pioneering advancements in energy technology? Do you want to be part of a team that is driving the global transition towards a sustainable future? If so, we have an exciting opportunity for you at Hitachi Energy. Our Technology & Solutions Development (business R&D) organization within HVDC is at the forefront of innovation, and we are looking for talented individuals to join us in Ludvika, Sweden.


For over 60 years, HVDC technology has been a cornerstone in the energy market, enabling the integration of renewable energy sources and supporting the transition to a more sustainable and reliable energy system. At Hitachi Energy, we are committed to developing cutting-edge solutions that address the world’s energy challenges. Our HVDC technology is crucial for connecting renewable energy sources to the grid, ensuring efficient and reliable transmission of electricity over long distances.


As a member of our team, you will have the opportunity to work on groundbreaking projects that make a real difference. You will be part of a collaborative and inclusive work environment where your ideas and expertise are valued. We believe in fostering a culture of innovation and continuous improvement, and we provide our employees with the tools and resources they need to succeed.


Discover more about our world-leading technology at www.hitachienergy.com/HVDC.

**Your Responsibilities**

* Join a world-class team to develop new solutions for high voltage electrical insulation applications in HVDC.
* Perform electric field calculations using advanced software like COMSOL and ANSYS, handling complex mechanical geometries.
* Utilize your expertise in high voltage testing to participate in dielectric tests, analyze results, and plan testing strategies.
* Work with the latest HVDC technology to develop new solutions or improve existing ones.
* Collaborate with colleagues worldwide, contributing to our latest HVDC technology and solutions.
* Be an integral part of a global team, working closely with colleagues to achieve common goals.

**Your Background**

* A master’s degree or PhD in a relevant technical discipline related to high voltage techniques and insulation.
* Proficiency in Matlab and programming tools such as Python, C++, or similar languages.
* Experience with electromagnetic field software like COMSOL, ANSYS, or similar.
* You have ability to work well in a team, with attention to detail and accuracy.
* You have a strong interest in technology and a willingness to share your knowledge.
* A strong problem-solving mindset and endurance to deliver and document high-quality technical solutions.

**What we offer**

* Collective agreement
* Flexible working time
* Health care and wellness allowance
* Fantastic career possibilities within Hitachi Energy both within Sweden and globally
* Mentor to support you throughout onboard phase
* Various trainings and education supporting employee development
* Diversified company with over 70+ nationalities working in Sweden
* Supplementary compensation for parental leave
* Employee Benefit Portal with thousands of discounts and perks
* More benefits could be connected to this specific role

**Additional information**


Are you ready for an exciting new challenge? Does the above description sound like you? Welcome to apply for this position!

**Recruiting Manager, Pankaj Roy,** Pankaj.roj@hitachienergy.com will answer your questions on the position. Union representatives - Sveriges Ingenjörer: Mikael Hjort, +46 107-38 29 86; Ledarna: Frank Hollstedt, +46 107-38 70 43; Unionen: Fredrik Holmgren, +46 107-38 21 85. Any other questions can be directed to Talent Partner Ingrid Schjelderup, Ingrid.schjelderup@hitachienergy.com


You will be based in Ludvika, Sweden & we offer flexible working – from – home options. Other flexible possibilities can be discussed prior written agreement is signed. Office location in Ludvika, Sweden is in the quite small but in this business famous town. Located in the centre of Sweden, about two hours’ drive from Stockholm. A calm city, close to nature with forest and lake areas where you can amuse yourself with activities all year around.

title: Entry Level Function Verification Engineer - Human Centric
description:
*Volvo Cars is on a mission to bring traditional car manufacturing into a connected, sustainable, and smart future. They have bold ambitions in innovation, safety, and electrification. Within the Safe Vehicle Automation (SVA) department, Volvo Cars lead the way in setting the industry standard for AD and ADAS function development, designing and verifying the complete vehicle solution for autonomous cars and active safety functions.*

**The team**


You will be a part of the Human Centric AD/ADAS group that design and verify functions like Road Sign Information, Driver Alert, and Connected Safety. Within the Human centric group there are a variety of different competences where some focus more on the HMI aspect and others are more focused on requirements and verification.


You will be a part of a team of experienced engineers with many years of experience in the area that you will have excellent opportunities to learn from. There are no silos within SVA as many of the teams have areas that overlap with each other – quite often there are collaborations across the teams in the department as well as with external suppliers.


**The role**


In this role you will enjoy a high degree of variety with both theoretical and practical tasks. You will get to experience and influence first-hand how the future AD/ADAS features will work and feel.


Together with your colleagues you will define functional requirements and use data for insights. You will also verify and validate features in different test environments such as vehicles, HIL (Hardware-In-the-Loop) and SIL (Software-In-the-Loop).


As part of the role, you will have the opportunity to go on expeditions outside of Sweden to test the features in different driving environments.


You will also work in close collaboration with external software suppliers and internal interfacing teams.


Examples of tasks:


* Define function requirements
* Verify features in car, HIL and SIL
* Plan, set up and execute test sessions

Analyse test results  

* 

  

**Your profile**


You get things done. You love learning and enjoy sharing your knowledge with others. You have a strong interest in and curiosity about technology and are eager to use data to inform development.


You’re willing to help out with tasks, even those you're less familiar with. You are an experienced driver with a strong interest—perhaps even a passion—for vehicles.


* Recently finished your Bachelor´s or Master´s degree in Mechatronics, Electronics, Engineering Physics or similar field
* Swedish B drivers license
* Interest in vehicles and/or automotive industry

Proficient English language skills, Swedish is considered a plus  

* 

  

Bonus:


* Python or other scripting language

**Talent program**


This position is a part of Hubbau's talent program and is a collaboration between Hubbau and Volvo Cars. During the 12 months of the talent program, you will be employed by Hubbau and work as a consultant in your specific role at Volvo Cars. The ambition is for your employment to smoothly transition to a permanent position at Volvo Cars thereafter. The goal is to provide you with an even more rewarding first year that sets you up for success at Volvo Cars and in your future career. The talent program offers training sessions from specialists within Vinngroup to build up your knowledge base.


**Start date**


Autumn 2024 or early 2025


**Other information**


The position is a full-time employment located at Volvo Cars office in Torslanda, Göteborg. We practice ongoing selection, so do not hesitate to express your interest.

title: Entry Level Function Verification Engineer - Autonomous...
description:
*Volvo Cars is on a mission to bring traditional car manufacturing into a connected, sustainable, and smart future. They have bold ambitions in innovation, safety, and electrification. Within the Safe Vehicle Automation (SVA) department, Volvo Cars lead the way in setting the industry standard for AD and ADAS function development, designing and verifying the complete vehicle solution for autonomous cars and active safety functions.*

**The team**


The team consists of two groups where one part is focused on function design, and the other on verification and validation and both are managed by the same Product Owner and Engineering Manager. The team has 18 members, with a relatively even split between the two groups. It includes a mix of experienced professionals and newer graduates, fostering a dynamic balance of ambition and expertise.


The group is diverse, both in terms of nationality and professional backgrounds and they aim to keep an atmosphere that is both caring and supportive.


**The role**


For this position we focus on the verification and validation role. In this role you will enjoy a high degree of variety with both theoretical and practical tasks. You will get to experience and influence first-hand how the future AD (autonomous drive) features will work and feel.


The role is practical, hands-on and involves coordinating and troubleshooting software, integrating it into the car, and running software tests. The work often takes place in cars or test platforms (HIL rigs), but does not involve actual test driving, it focuses more on preparations and software integration testing.


Together with your colleagues you will define functional requirements and use data for insights. You will also verify and validate features both in vehicles and HIL (Hardware-In-the-Loop).


Regardless of which area you primarily work in, you can rotate between focus areas depending on the needs of the organization.


**Your profile**


To work in this team, you should have proficiency in Python and like to work hands-on. Troubleshooting and resolving issues is exciting to you and you have the ability to follow through but most importantly the eagerness to learn and take initiative.


We also want you to:


* Recently finished your Bachelor´s or Master´s degree in Mechatronics, Electronics, Engineering Physics or similar field
* Have knowledge of communication protocols like CAN or CANoe is a big bonus
* Be fluent in English, Swedish is meritorious
* Swedish driver's license
* Interest in vehicles and/or the automotive industry

**Talent program**


This position is a part of Hubbau's talent program and is a collaboration between Hubbau and Volvo Cars. During the 12 months of the talent program, you will be employed by Hubbau and work as a consultant in your specific role at Volvo Cars. The ambition is for your employment to smoothly transition to a permanent position at Volvo Cars thereafter. The goal is to provide you with an even more rewarding first year that sets you up for success at Volvo Cars and in your future career. The talent program offers training sessions from specialists within Vinngroup to build up your knowledge base.


**Start date**


Autumn 2024 or early 2025


**Other information**


The position is a full-time employment located at Volvo Cars office in Torslanda, Göteborg. We practice ongoing selection, so do not hesitate to express your interest.

title: AI Engineer / Lead på TechSeed
description:
*På TechSeed är vi övertygade om att det är tekniken som kommer göra världen till en bättre plats. Vi ser ett stort behov i vårt samhälle att kombinera affärsförståelse, digitalt ledarskap samt innovativa arbetssätt och lösningar med framtidens tekniker i uppkopplade ekosystem. Vi tror på en hållbar framtid med säkra lösningar genom exempelvis IoT-lösningar, digitala tvillingar, AI och cybersäkerhet. Det här är vårt WHY och det fyller oss med energi varje dag. Det här är vår arena.*


TechSeed är ett medarbetarägt bolag som erbjuder konsulttjänster och har ett kompetensdjup inom flera domäner. Vi är på en kraftig tillväxtresa och söker nu Business Intelligence Developers som även kommer få en stor grad av inflytande och insyn i hur vi växer framåt och tar ett helhetsgrepp om uppkopplade ekosystem och lösningar. Vi söker dig som trivs i konsultrollen och samtidigt vill bidra till att skapa vägen framåt för TechSeed – Tillsammans.


Som AI Engineer / Lead på TechSeed kommer du att arbeta som konsult i samarbete med våra kunder samt arbeta internt för att driva vårt AI-arbete framåt. Som en del av TechSeed Data Insights kommer du att bidra till att företag kan fatta välgrundade beslut genom att dra nytta av insikter från AI, ML, IoT och traditionell Business Intelligence. Hos Data Insights hittar du engagerade och kunniga kollegor med kompetens inom data strategi, arkitektur, data engineering, AI/ML och rapportering. Som delägare och anställd kommer du vara med i utvecklingen av våra erbjudanden, få möjlighet att påverka de områden som du drivs av och samtidigt få tryggheten av ett team med gemensamt mål och gemensamma intressen.


Vår grund ligger i att vi delar med oss av vår passion för teknik och värdet vi skapar. Det handlar bland annat om kunskapsutbyte och att dela idéer, bidra med god stämning såväl som att skapa värde genom vårt delägarskap. Vi erbjuder dig:

* Inflytande i hur vi bygger TechSeed tillsammans
* En öppen kultur där vi värdesätter olikheter, insikter och innovationer
* Direkt värde från våra finansiella resultat genom bonus och delägarskap
* Möjligheten att växa in i olika tekniska områden / ansvarsområden utifrån dina önskemål
* Flexibelt arbete hemifrån, beroende på uppdragets behov.

**Vem söker vi?**


Vi söker efter dig som vill hjälpa våra kunder hitta nya innovativa sätt att nyttja AI-teknik och har en förmåga att förenkla det komplexa. Du är analytisk, har ett inre driv och genuint intresse för att den tekniska utvecklingen inom AI och intelligent automation.


I rollen som konsult kan uppdragen variera beroende på vilka erfarenheter du har med dig och vilka ambitioner du har för framtiden, men våra grundkrav för rollen är att du har minst **5 års arbetslivserfarenhet som Data Engineer, Data Scientist eller Software Development**, samt minst 2 års erfarenhet av implementationer av AI/ML och goda kunskaper i exempelvis Python-


Det är även meriterande om du besitter kunskap inom:

  

* Verktyg inom intelligent automation t.ex. Power Automate, UiPath, Blueprism
* API och integrationer
* Projektledning
* Microsoft Azure


Eftersom vi arbetar med flera typer av kunder med olika behov krävs det för rollen att vara obehindrad i både svenska och engelska, tal och skrift. Det är även meriterande om du har erfarenhet av att jobba på ett start/scale-up samt har tidigare konsulterfarenhet.

**Om TechSeed**


Vi är ett medarbetarägt konsultbolag i ScaleUp-fasen med visionen att skapa värde med uppkopplade lösningar. Vi tror på kombinationen av nära samarbeten, framtidens tekniker och att gemensamt arbeta för att skapa ett bolag vi verkligen trivs på. Genom att erbjuda delägarskap till våra anställda ger vi möjligheten till insyn och påverkan, samtidigt som det gynnar samarbeten och att prioritera vad som är bäst för gruppen. Detta speglas både i vår kultur och våra erbjudanden, där vi kombinerar vårt stora tekniska intresse med ett kundanpassat förhållningssätt samtidigt som vi har många sociala aktiviteter och en härlig gemenskap på kontoret. Vår arena är uppkopplade ekosystem, där tekniker som IoT och Intelligent Edge används för att skapa uppkopplade tjänster och system inom ekosystem som Smart Cities, Smart Factories, Smart Companies och Smart Buildings.

title: Frostbite: Character Physics Intern
description:
Frostbite is EA's proprietary game engine that comes equipped with tons of technologies designed to build incredible games. Our in-house engine offers the unique ability to adapt to each game while working hand-in-hand to prioritize what to build. Our goal is to empower creators all over the world to bring their best ideas to life by creating an engine that amplifies innovation across every discipline.


**Responsibilities**


* You will work in the Cloth and Hair Physics team, developing solutions for cloth and character hair simulation.
* You will work as a software engineer on the development of the team's products.
* You will report to the engineering manager.

**Requirements**


* Solid knowledge of C++ and systems programming
* Understanding of linear algebra and 3D math

We are looking for candidates with some or all of the following skills:


* Knowledge of physics simulation, game physics, cloth simulation.
* Experience with game development, game engine programming, GPU programming.

This is an unpaid temporary employment (Jan - Jun 2025) and it needs to be associated with an ongoing M.Sc. programme in Computer Science, Engineering or a related field in Sweden.


We look forward to receiving your application!


  

Electronic Arts creates next-level entertainment experiences that inspire players and fans around the world. Here, everyone is part of the story. Part of a community that connects across the globe. A place where creativity thrives, new perspectives are invited, and ideas matter. A team where everyone makes play happen.

title: Systems Engineer - Rockets & Balloons
description:
###### **Esrange Space Center**


**SYSTEMS ENGINEER - ROCKETS & BALLOONS**



At the Swedish Space Corporation, we enable our customers to make better use of space. The Science Services Division develops rocket and balloon systems including experimental equipment for microgravity research and development. We are an industry leader at successfully launching rockets and balloons from our facility at Esrange Space Center.


**YOUR ROLE**



We offer the opportunity to join the Science Services Rocket and Balloon division which is entrusted to develop and maintain critical systems required to support our customer’s needs. As a Systems Engineer in the Instrumentation department your role will be to oversee the development and sustainability over a wide realm of systems. This includes but not limited to systems used across multiple SSC departments, support the development of new systems for internal and external projects and participating in the successful completion of customer campaign requirements with a focus on telemetry systems and sub systems for the launching and recovery of rockets and balloon payloads.


**Examples of work tasks:**


* Troubleshooting and analyzing equipment issues for permanent and temporary installed systems.
* Understanding and analyzing requirements for internal and external development projects and encompassing those needs into a sustainable service that fits into the overall business expansion at Esrange.
* Track and document changes on overall deliverables for internal and external projects.
* Support the maintenance, development and implementation for established and new systems.
* Provide system coordination and reporting per customer requirements to enable technical implementations to be delivered on time and on budget.


**WHO YOU ARE**



If you have a drive to learn with a vast interest in technical fields attributed to the operational sustainability of a space port, we want to hear from you! We address basic and complex technical challenges daily and collaboration in an international environment. Having experience with RF Systems, PCB design and network hardware integration is highly sought after. Knowledge in **Python, Rust, Perforce** and **GitLab** programming and development software is valued. As we operate in a highly technical niche business, we would greatly appreciate you to be able to write technical documentation and follow formal processes.


**We also believe you have:**


* Bachelor’s or master’s degree in a technical field or have corresponding experience.
* Background in Telemetry, Telecommunications, Science or Space Technology and a general interest in supporting space port operations.
* You are comfortable communicating in Swedish and English, both written and spoken.
* This role requires a valid driver’s license and access to a car.


 **WE OFFER YOU**


* A unique opportunity to work with a variety of projects within the space industry participating in ground, suborbital and orbital launch services.
* An excellent opportunity for personal and career development.
* An international workplace characterized by an open atmosphere and a challenging work environment that continues to evolve.


**LOCATION**



This is a permanent full-time position located at Esrange Space Center, Kiruna. As part of our team, you will participate in rocket and balloon campaigns that can be scheduled outside of regular business hours. Occasional requirements to work campaigns with our international partners outside of Sweden will be required.


**N****EXT STEP**



Please apply with your CV. We will be evaluating applications continuously. This is a security classified position and requires a background control before employment. For more details or questions, please contact our Talent Acqusition Partner Peggy - peggy.fatahzadeh@sscspace.com. Please note that the application should be sent through our career page.


**WE HELP EARTH BENEFIT FROM SPACE**



Swedish Space Corporation (SSC) is a leading global provider of advanced space services with more than fifty years of experience. Since our start pioneering scientific rocket launches in northern Sweden, we have grown into a renowned, full-service supplier of state-of-the-art space engineering, satellite and launch services to commercial and institutional customers worldwide.

title: Application Engineer - Mechanical
description:
An exciting new opportunity has arisen for a mechanical **Application Engineer** to join the Aftermarket Projects department at Kongsberg Maritime in Kristinehamn. We are looking for a driven, solution-oriented mechanical engineer who enjoys both technical challenges and project-based work.


As Application Engineer you join a multi-skilled technical department that handles everything from system adaption and interface issues through to detailed construction for manufacturing and purchasing. The team’s specialist areas include mechanics, electronics and hydraulics. As specialist for mechanics, you are the technical lead in projects from signed contract through to installation. You have an overall responsibility for the mechanical construction of our customer orders, including design and adaptation according to our customers specific needs where almost every project is unique. In this position you will work in close collaboration with our customers and suppliers as well as internal functions, such as project management, purchasing and service engineers.

**What we can offer**


A position with a wide range of challenging work tasks, opportunities to make a real difference and develop on a technical and personal level. You will have the opportunity to work with unique products and shape your role based on your interest and background for the world-leading supplier of maritime solutions. You will work in an international work environment and in multidisciplinary team collaboration. We can offer flexible working hours and the option to work partly remote based on your work tasks.

**Qualifications and experience**


To succeed in this position, you should have a degree in Mechanical Engineering or relevant field in addition to industry work experience. In our global organization and market, a high level of English, both written and oral is essential. We expect you have earlier experience in NX 3D CAD or other similar design software.


We appreciate your ability to act on your own initiative, make things happen and accept responsibility for the results. In taking on the technical lead for mechanical construction within projects, it is critical to use a systematic approach in planning your work and defining clear priorities. Teamwork is key to succeed in this position, therefore, we value your ability to build a useful network of contacts and relationships, co-operate well with others, share knowledge and experience as well as supporting others in the pursuit of team goals.

**Last day to apply 2024-10-14**


For this position we work with personality and ability tests, which may be sent to you if you proceed in the process. Interviews may start during the application period as we wish to fill this position as soon as possible.

*Since we are a company working with customers in the Naval segment, questions related to citizenship will be part of the selection process.*

 **Point of contact**

**Peter Mähler**, Team Manager Aftermarket Projects, Propulsion


+46 70 513 81 85, peter.mahler@km.kongsberg.com

**Georgina Fielding**, HR Specialist


+46 73 894 55 92, georgina.fielding@km.kongsberg.com

 **Kongsberg Maritime** is a technology pioneer, enabling a more sustainable future for our oceans. Our zero-emission integrated technologies advance the maritime industry and solve our customers' toughest problems. With unmatched competence, domain knowledge, innovation, and market reach, we are the trusted maritime partner. Headquartered in Kongsberg, Norway, the company has manufacturing, sales and service facilities in 35 countries.

**Kongsberg Maritime, Kristinehamn** consists of 320 engaged people working with sales, research, development, design, service, training and assembly of market leading marine solutions. Our Hydrodynamic Research Centre is one of the world’s leading marine hydrodynamic research facilities, specialized in development, design and testing of marine propulsion systems.

**Kongsberg Maritime** has a commitment in **Sustainable Development Goals** and for us, the oceans and marine resources are important. We therefore strive to develop products that help reduce emissions and damage to life below water. We believe in a workplace characterized by diversity and together we can create a work environment that brings the best out of everyone. We are very positive that you want to contribute to our development, and that you want to develop within Kongsberg.


At Kongsberg, we believe in tackling challenging problems and delivering extreme performance for extreme conditions. We do that through excellent products and services developed for delivering the greatest benefits to our customers.

 **Pro****tec****ting people and planet**

title: Senior Software Quality Assurance Engineer till Gradientech
description:
Hos Gradientechfår du möjlighet att taansvar för kvalitetssäkring av bolagets samtliga mjukvaruprodukter samt interna mjukvaruverktyg. Hos Gradientech får du inte bara en chans att vidareutvecklas professionellt, utan också möjligheten att göra verklig skillnad i kampen mot antibiotikaresistens och förbättra patientvården över hela världen.
  
Om teamet & rollenGradientech är idag omkring 40 anställda varav cirka hälften ingår i utvecklingsteamen.Du kommer att arbeta nära och tillsammans med utvecklare och QA/Reg i agila team för mjukvaruutveckling och systemutveckling. Du kommer rapportera till bolagets CTO.Gradientech har kontor och produktionslokaler belägna i Uppsala Science Park. På Gradientech jobbar man från kontoret.
  
I rollen som Senior Software Quality Assurance Engineer kommer du ha stor fokus på kvalitetssäkring av mjukvara kopplad till bolagets IVD-produkter, på instrument- och på applikationsnivå. Det innebär att du kommer delta itest, verifierings- och valideringsarbete inför frisläppning av mjukvara. Du kommer ävenatt delta i kravinsamling och kravanalys för utveckling av befintliga och nya produkter. Samtdelta i aktiv dialog med slutkunder och/eller studiepartners för att föreslå nödvändiga förändringar/förbättringar.
  
  

**Utöver detta kommer du även ha fokus på:**  

Arbeta riskbaserat och kvalitetsmedvetet med utgångspunkt från ISO13485, IEC62304 och ISO14971 samt tillämpliga guidelines från FDA.
  
Delta i arbete med att säkerställa cyber security inom ramen för CE-IVDR och FDA.
  
Arbete med bolagets lösningar för continuous development/deployment/integration. Där ingår verktyg för test, frisläppning och distribution av mjukvaruprodukter.
  
  

**Om digVi söker dig som har:**  

En ingenjörsbakgrund alt systemvetare
  
Erfarenhet av rollen som mjukvarutestare där du skrivit krav, satt upp automattester och jobbat med kvalitetssäkring
  
Ett intresse av den övriga kvalitetssäkringen
  
Kommunicerar obehindrat på engelska och har god förståelse för svenska språket
  
  

Vi ser det som meriterande om du har jobbat med test inom medtech alt liknande branscher där det är högt ställda kvalitetskrav.
  
Som person gillar du utmaningen med att arbeta i ett mindre bolag, något som erbjuder korta beslutsprocesser, oändlig utvecklingspotential, omväxlande arbetsuppgifter och ett stort eget ansvar. Rollen ställer höga krav på din noggrannhet, analytiska förmåga och samarbetsförmåga då du ingår i många olika samarbeten internt.
  
Om GRADIENTECHGradientech utvecklar och säljer ett CE-märkt diagnostiksystem (IVD) för antibiotikaresistensbestämning (AST) avsett för kliniska mikrobiologilaboratorier. Vårt AST system kan inom 2-4 timmar diagnostisera vilken antibiotika en patient bör behandlas med och är det idag snabbaste på marknaden för sepsisprover. Systemet marknadsförs under varumärket QuickMIC och består av en instrumentenhet med dedikerad analysmjukvara och tillhörande engångsprodukter – antibiotikakassetter. Försäljning i Europa sker via nära samarbete med specialiserade distributörer. title: Software Engineering Analyst
description:
**Do you want to create the future with us?**  

  

The future belongs to those who are empowered by a great idea and have the ability to carry it out. At Volvo Cars we are redefining the automotive experience and are innovating to make people’s lives less complicated. Freedom to move in a safe, personal and sustainable way!

  


**What do we offer?**  

Volvo Cars is on an ambitious journey to re-define the experience related to car usage and ownership. Combining technologies and innovative services, we are committed to offer the most personal, safe and sustainable solutions in mobility.  

  

At our department of Autonomous Drive and ADAS Functions we design, integrate and verify the complete vehicle solution for autonomous cars and active safety functions. We collaborate with some of the most innovative industry partners to reach our future visions of safety, convenience and mobility.  

  

Autonomous drive has the potential to fundamentally change how cars are used and are part of our society. As a member of the AD Function teams you will contribute to the team purpose to take the lead in safe, customer valued and purposeful functions for Autonomous Driving (AD). The responsibility, communal with the teams, is to develop and launch a robust and safe, human-centric, self-driving functionality.  

  

**What you´ll do?**  

We are now looking for an engineer with competence in function verification to join our function verification team. You will contribute with your verification competence to ensure that team with confidence continuously can understand the maturity of the function and how to secure delivery of the complete function.  

  

You will be part of a team with competences in function Verification and Validation (V&V) and with passion for virtual verification methods using SIL and HIL. The verification team shares objectives and backlog with other teams in AD Function, the customer function development team and the systemization and integration team. Working with verification comes with collaboration with multiple teams at Volvo Cars and with our supplier Zenseact, all excited to bring AD experience to customers. Developing safe AD is advanced engineering as well as personal development and learning is essential.  

  

**Do you fit the profile?**  

  

Most important is that you are a person that interested and excited to work with Autonomous Driving and that you have experience that will make you contribute to the verification of advanced functions for safety and customer value.  

  

**Meritorious competence:**  

Experience from function SW integration and function testing in virtual environments and on test tracks and real roads.  

Defining, adopting and executing on test plans based on input from the collective knowledge, verification strategies and requirements  

Able to analyse complex test data, make conclusions, summarise, communicate and document the results.  

Development of test methods for function SW integration and testing, reading and writing requirements. Creating unit and component tests for automated testing for continuous integration and deployment (CI/CD).  

Python programming skills.  

You probably have a M.Sc. degree or comparable experience and is fluent in spoken and written English.  

We look for diversity.  

  

**Who are you?**  

  

We are curious, We create together and We make a difference. This is our culture and we like to think that you feel connected to this and that this is something you can represent and support, than you are the person we look for.


* You are curious
* You put user experience first.
* You learn every day and innovate.
* You create together
* You build trust and maximise our strengths. We have fun and have no limits to where we contribute.
* You make the difference
* You care about people and the world we live in. We get things done.

  




We want your application written in English and submitted at the latest 18th, October 2024. Please note that applications via email will not be accepted.


**Volvo Cars - Driving change together.**  

  

Volvo Cars’ success is the result of collaborative, diverse and inclusive working environment. Today, we are one of the most well-known and respected car brands, with around 43,000 employees across the globe. At Volvo Cars, your career is designed around your skills and aspirations, allowing you to reach your fullest potential.
company_description: At Volvo Car Group, our vision is clear: "To be the world's most progressive and desired premium car brand".

title: Senior Automotive NVH Engineer
description:
ARE YOU READY TO REINVENT MOBILITY AND WORK AT A "GREAT PLACE TO WORK" CERTIFIED WORKPLACE? GET US STARTED TODAY AND BECOME PART OF OUR AGILE AND INTERNATIONAL TEAM
  
EDAG, one of the leading global engineering experts with a heritage in the automotive industry, serves its customers with a complete development responsibility, from concept work to even building prototypes. Whether it is software development, development of future mobility solutions, sustainability, design technology, quality assurance, manufacturing technology or various other engineering requests, for more than 50 years EDAG has successfully helped its customers take the next technological leap.
  
We are looking for Senior Automotive NVH Engineer who will work on E-mobility. Our sound and vibration- NVH team are professionals with extensive knowledge in structural dynamics,vibration & acoustics, data acquistion and signal processing.Our area of focus include Automotive NVH, Industrial vibration & acoustics, audio-digital processor development, Mechanical/Structural systems diagnostics. You will be a part of a global team of dynamic and innovative team that is preferred solution partner for the industry.
  
Your Responsibilities
  
Support the NVH development of a vehicle or product design based on the overall legal and customer requirements for noise and vibration on component and vehicle level.
  
To specify and follow up the requirements on subsystems and components in close cooperation with other engineering functions as well as sub-suppliers.
  
Investigate in-service problems, develop, and recommend solutions.
  
Active participation in NVH test, analysis, and troubleshooting.
  
Provide specialized consulting to relevant departments to help solve system noise and vibration issues.
  
Guide in noise and vibration source fixation in both vehicle and components.
  
Actively establishing and shaping customer relationships.
  
Communicating with, advising, and supporting our customers and internal development teams
  
  

Our Requirements
  
B.Sc. and/or M.Sc. degree in Engineering or Physics with detailed knowledge of acoustics, structural dynamics and/or vibration control, as well as digital signal processing.
  
Minimum 6 years of NVH engineering experience in the automotive industry. Experience in one or more of the following areas: Body NVH, Chassis NVH, Powertrain NVH (preferably e-driveline), Sound Quality, Climate NVH, Homologation NVH, Audio and Active Sound Control.
  
Good Experience in data acquisition and signal processing tools of Müller BBM-VAS, Siemens Simcenter, Head Acoustics, Dewesoft and similar.
  
Good Experience in programming with Python, MATLAB or similar, for CAE script development or signal processing algorithm development.
  
Good understanding of simulations and CAE work in NVH, even if there is no hands-on experience.
  
Ability to perform hands-on work, assembling-mounting test objects, performing tests on rigs and similar.
  
Ability to lead teams and work, having a holistic approach to product development.
  
Self-driven, collaborative, active, solution-oriented personality
  
Valid driving license B.
  
Fluent in professional English, both written and spoken.
  
  

Meritorious
  
Proven CAE experience in automotive industry
  
Proving ground driving license (T1 or T2)
  
Swedish
  
  

**We Offer:**  

We welcome you in to our open and diverse culture. We promise you a lot of opportunities to grow and learn as you become a part of a dynamic and creative team who are at the top of their field. With leading-edge technology, we help our customer’s vision become a reality. We are an engineer’s playground of innovation and creativity that is fast, furious and fun!

title: Core Engineer
description:
As a Core Engineer at Ordo One you will have the opportunity to work on highly available, high-performance server-side components and frameworks that support our platform. You will work in close cooperation with the rest of our core engineering team to build and maintain our Swift-based technology stack that powers our macOS applications and Linux backend.
  
Key Responsibilities
  
Design, implement, and maintain core infrastructure components and libraries using Swift
  
Build scalable, high-performance server-side software using Swift on Linux and macOS
  
Write comprehensive unit and integration tests to ensure code quality and reliability
  
Collaborate with the team to identify and address performance bottlenecks and optimize system efficiency
  
Contribute to Open Source projects relevant to Ordo One's technology stack
  
Participate in code reviews and provide constructive feedback to maintain high coding standards
  
Stay up-to-date with the latest trends and best practices in Swift development
  
  

Requirements
  
Strong proficiency in Swift programming language for both server-side and client-side development
  
Experience building and maintaining high-performance, scalable backend systems
  
Solid understanding of software development principles, design patterns, and best practices
  
Familiarity with Linux and macOS operating systems and their respective ecosystems
  
Skilled at writing clean, maintainable, and well-documented code
  
Experience with unit testing, integration testing, and continuous integration/deployment practices
  
Excellent problem-solving and debugging skills
  
Strong collaboration and communication abilities to work effectively in a team environment
  
Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field
  
  

If you are passionate about crafting elegant and efficient solutions using Swift, and you thrive in a collaborative, fast-paced startup environment, we would love to have you join our core engineering team. You will have the chance to make a significant impact on our Swift-based technology stack and contribute to the growth of our platform.

title: Senior Software Quality Assurance Engineer till Gradientech
description:
**Hos Gradientech får du möjlighet att ta ansvar för kvalitetssäkring av bolagets samtliga mjukvaruprodukter samt interna mjukvaruverktyg. Hos Gradientech får du inte bara en chans att vidareutvecklas professionellt, utan också möjligheten att göra verklig skillnad i kampen mot antibiotikaresistens och förbättra patientvården över hela världen.**

 **Om teamet & rollen**  

Gradientech är idag omkring 40 anställda varav cirka hälften ingår i utvecklingsteamen. Du kommer att arbeta nära och tillsammans med utvecklare och QA/Reg i agila team för mjukvaruutveckling och systemutveckling. Du kommer rapportera till bolagets CTO. Gradientech har kontor och produktionslokaler belägna i Uppsala Science Park. På Gradientech jobbar man från kontoret.


I rollen som Senior Software Quality Assurance Engineer kommer du ha stor fokus på kvalitetssäkring av mjukvara kopplad till bolagets IVD-produkter, på instrument- och på applikationsnivå. Det innebär att du kommer delta i test, verifierings- och valideringsarbete inför frisläppning av mjukvara. Du kommer även att delta i kravinsamling och kravanalys för utveckling av befintliga och nya produkter. Samt delta i aktiv dialog med slutkunder och/eller studiepartners för att föreslå nödvändiga förändringar/förbättringar.


Utöver detta kommer du även ha fokus på:

* Arbeta riskbaserat och kvalitetsmedvetet med utgångspunkt från ISO13485, IEC62304 och ISO14971 samt tillämpliga guidelines från FDA.
* Delta i arbete med att säkerställa cyber security inom ramen för CE-IVDR och FDA.
* Arbete med bolagets lösningar för continuous development/deployment/integration. Där ingår verktyg för test, frisläppning och distribution av mjukvaruprodukter.

  


  

**Om dig**  

Vi söker dig som har:

* En ingenjörsbakgrund alt systemvetare
* Erfarenhet av rollen som mjukvarutestare där du skrivit krav, satt upp automattester och jobbat med kvalitetssäkring
* Ett intresse av den övriga kvalitetssäkringen
* Kommunicerar obehindrat på engelska och har god förståelse för svenska språket


Vi ser det som meriterande om du har jobbat med test inom medtech alt liknande branscher där det är högt ställda kvalitetskrav.


Som person gillar du utmaningen med att arbeta i ett mindre bolag, något som erbjuder korta beslutsprocesser, oändlig utvecklingspotential, omväxlande arbetsuppgifter och ett stort eget ansvar. Rollen ställer höga krav på din noggrannhet, analytiska förmåga och samarbetsförmåga då du ingår i många olika samarbeten internt.

 **Om** **GRADIENTECH**  

Gradientech utvecklar och säljer ett CE-märkt diagnostiksystem (IVD) för antibiotikaresistensbestämning (AST) avsett för kliniska mikrobiologilaboratorier. Vårt AST system kan inom 2-4 timmar diagnostisera vilken antibiotika en patient bör behandlas med och är det idag snabbaste på marknaden för sepsisprover. Systemet marknadsförs under varumärket QuickMIC och består av en instrumentenhet med dedikerad analysmjukvara och tillhörande engångsprodukter – antibiotikakassetter. Försäljning i Europa sker via nära samarbete med specialiserade distributörer. Gradientech arbetar i ett reglerat kvalitetsledningssystem och är ISO13485 certifierat för IVD produktutveckling, tillverkning och försäljning.

 **Välkommen med din ansökan!**  

Tror du att detta skulle passa dig, eller kanske någon du känner? Vi har ett löpande urval och kan komma att tillsätta tjänsten innan sista ansökningsdag, tveka därför inte - utan skicka in din ansökan redan idag!


Rekryteringen kommer hållas av Ed:Za Group. Har du några frågor eller funderingar relaterade till tjänsten och processen är du varmt välkommen att kontakta oss på charlotte.hoffstrom@edzagroup.se

title: Software System Engineer
description:
**Work Schedule**


Other**Environmental Conditions**


Office**Job Description**

**Discover Impactful Work:**


This position is based on our site in Uppsala, where Thermo Fisher develops, manufactures, and markets complete blood test systems to support the clinical diagnosis and monitoring of allergy, asthma, and autoimmune diseases. With 1,900 employees worldwide working with these products, and 1,000 in Sweden, we are the global leader in in-vitro allergy testing and the European leader in autoimmunity diagnostics.

**What will you do**


Within our development projects we perform a meaningful number of studies during development, verification, and validation phase to secure the performance of our system. To aid, streamline and automize this process as far as possible we are currently building a software system for internal data management, statistical analysis and report handling.


As a Software System Engineer in the project, you will play a critical role in designing and customizing the architecture of the system. This means that you will need to understand the architecture of the system and how it is developed at the same time as you need to understand the need from the end user. This requires involvement with the developing team, IT, R&D, our biometrics and regulatory team.

**How will you get there?**

* You have a Bachelor’s/Master degree in Software Engineering (or equivalent)
* Experience from developing or configuring software systems. Having worked with LIMS system could be a merit
* As a person, you should be someone who takes initiatives and works in a structured way within the project team
* Strong self-leadership, including team lead and presentation skills.
* Ability to collaborate with people with various competencies.
* Ability of working independently, taking ownership for the management of processes, projects, and timelines.
* Clear communicator, both verbally and written English
* Skilled to work across departments, in a matrix organization
* Most of all you should enjoy working in a team that wants to have fun at work helping each other creating great products.

**Work Environment**


You will work from our office in Uppsala, Sweden with possibility for remote work in line with our policies.

**Benefits**


We are an innovative, forward-thinking organization, and outstanding career and development prospects. We offer an exciting company culture that stands for integrity, intensity, involvement, and innovation! We believe it is not only the salary that matters when you decide to take up employment with us. We offer competitive remuneration, annual incentive plan bonus, healthcare, and a range of employee benefits such as health benefits, flexible working hours, and a bonus scheme for all employees.


Apply today! http://jobs.thermofisher.com


Please send in your application, including a cover letter, CV (in one document) in English, apply via http://jobs.thermofisher.com/. Please apply as soon as possible, the position will be filled as soon as suitable candidate is found.
company_description: At Thermo Fisher Scientific, our professionals develop critical solutions—and build rewarding careers.

title: Erfaren konsultchef inom Mjukvaru- och Systemutveckling
description:
### **JOB DESCRIPTION**



Söker du en arbetsplats där du dagligen får utmanas och utvecklas inom entreprenörskap, ledarskap och ingenjörskap? Då är Sigma Industry Development rätt företag för dig.



Sigma Industry Development är ett dotterbolag inom SIEN-koncernen som fortsätter sin framgångsrika tillväxtresa utan att tumma på kvalitet. Två år i följd har pris vunnits som ett av Sveriges bäst välskötta företag, samt topp10-ranking i medarbetartrivsel på nationell nivå. Med andra ord är manegen krattad för fortsatta framgångar och arbetsglädje.



Nu söker vi en konsultchef till sektionen Mekatronik. Sektionen utgörs idag av 13 ingenjörer inom AI, mjukvaru- och hårdvaruutveckling, test och verifiering. Du kommer ha fördelen att ansluta dig till en etablerad kundbas, men ha fria tyglar att sätta din prägel på verksamheten och dess framtida strategi, samtidigt som teamet vill utvecklas genom ditt ledarskap och målsättningar.


### **BASIC QUALIFICATIONS**



Din uppgift är att hjälpa teamet och verksamheten att utvecklas ytterligare, genom att navigera mot hög tillväxt och säkerställa nya affärer. Din roll är mångfacetterad där du kommer arbetar med att anställa de bästa talangerna och utveckla dessa, samtidigt som du brinner för affärsutveckling där målet är att etablera nya kundsamarbeten och driver in de stora affärerna. Detta utan att varken köra slut på ditt bränsle eller skada den goda (arbets-) miljön.



Vi ser att du har erfarenhet från försäljning och ledarskap i konsultbranschen, samt ett brett nätverk i Stockholmsregionen och du är en person som inte bara snackar utan gillar att få saker att hända.



**Utbildning**



* MSc i Datavetenskap, Mekatronik, Teknisk fysik, eller liknande utbildningsbakgrund **eller** har förvärvat motsvarande kunskap genom flera års erfarenhet inom området.


**Erfarenhet inom**


* Minst 5 års dokumenterad erfarenhet av ledarskap och försäljning inom konsultbranschen, särskilt inom mjukvaru- och systemutveckling.
* Gedigen erfarenhet av att bygga och leda team samt utveckla långsiktiga kundrelationer.


**Språkkunskap**



* Svenska och engelska, flytande i tal och skrift (båda är krav för anställning)

### **PREFERRED ADDITIONAL SKILLS, PERSONAL TRAITS AND EXPERIENCE**



Om AI har en speciell plats i ditt ingenjörshjärta, betraktar vi detta som en extra fördel. Vi som företag är måna om att hålla jämna takt med omvärlden och vi har som strategi att kontinuerligt fördjupa oss i de fördelar artificiell intelligens för med sig, i syfte att öka produktivitet - för oss och våra kunder.


### **WE OFFER**



Sigma Industry Development erbjuder dig en plattform att forma din framtid. Ett företag där du kan briljera och bidra till det bättre.



**Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR) – ett urval**



https://starforlife.org/



https://expectabettertomorrow.com/



https://www.parasport.se/



https://rfkhumanrights.org/leadership-council



**Våra Kärnvärden**



* Familjär identitet - vi värnar om och utmanar varandra i det dagliga arbetet
* Långsiktighet - vi vill växa tillsammans med individen på kort och lång sikt
* Jämställdhet och lika behandling - kom som du är!
* Kreativitet & action - vi är beslutsamma och agerar i sann entreprenörsanda; framåt
* Arbetsglädje - vi gillar att ha kul tillsammans!


**Till detta tillkommer följande förmåner**



* Mobiltelefon och abonnemang
* Liv- och olycksförsäkring
* Friskvårdsbidrag om 5000 SEK/år
* 30 dagar semester

### **MORE INFORMATION**



Om du vill vidareutvecklas i rollen som Konsultchef – ta dig mod och skicka in din ansökan till oss idag! Skriv även några rader med dina tankar om tjänsten. Intervjuer sker löpande så vänta inte.



Om du har frågor är du varmt välkommen att höra av dig till Oscar för frågor och mer info.



Oscar Silversparf, VD, Sigma Industry Development



+46 70 209 22 26



oscar.silversparf@sigma.se



* #### **POSITION**


Erfaren konsultchef inom Mjukvaru- och Systemutveckling
* #### **COMPANY**


Sigma Industry Development

Sweden
* #### **COMPETENCE AREA**


Mechanical Engineering, Hardware Electronics, Testing and Verification, Project Management, Software development embedded systems, Function development, System design, Project Management, Software development

2024-09-16
* #### **EXPIRATION DATE**


2024-10-31
* #### **CONTACT**


Oscar Silversparf, oscar.silversparf@sigma.se, +46702092226

title: Web Developer
description:
*The world’s most popular audio streaming subscription service is looking for a
 **Web Developer** 
 to join the band in a consultant assignment. The client has transformed music listening forever when launched in 2008.* 




***Period:** 
 2024-11-04 to 2025-05-04 (full-time), with a possibility of extension.*

 We are looking for an experienced web developer that will join our client's Experimentation Platform team. You will work as part of a cross-functional team that designs, builds and supports a world-class tool for A/B testing and feature development.
   

  

 Our client is proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. They strongly believe that diversity in experience, perspectives, and backgrounds leads to a better environment for employees and enhances the products they create for both users and creators. This commitment is deeply valued, and they encourage everyone to join them in changing the way the world listens to music.
 


 What you'll do

 Who you are

 We are Market Partner
